    • Method Detail

      • setHeader

        void setHeader(java.lang.String... columns)
        throws CSVException
        Set the Header values into CSV File.

        Parameters:
        columns - Using String[] array.
        Throws:
        CSVException - throws CSVException

      • set

        void set(int index,
         java.lang.Object value)
  throws CSVException
        Set the row values using header index position.The content is based on header content.

        Parameters:
        index - Integer value presents column position or index position based on header content.
        value - The value is declared as object.

        So the input values will be any Primitive Data types and String.

        char,byte,short,int,long,double,float,boolean and String. Date, Email, URL is parsed by String Values using com.report.csv.util.CSVParser.

        Throws:
        CSVException - throws CSVException

      • set

        void set(java.lang.String column,
         java.lang.Object value)
  throws CSVException
        Set the row values using header column content.

        Parameters:
        column - String represent the Header Values.
        value - The value is declared as object.

        So the input values will be any Primitive Data types and String.

        char,byte,short,int,long,double,float,boolean and String. Date, Email, URL is parsed by String Values using com.report.csv.util.CSVParser.

        Throws:
        CSVException - throws CSVException

      • next

        void next()
   throws CSVException
        Organize the Row values based on Header Content.

        Throws:
        CSVException - throws CSVException with Message.

      • writeData

        void writeData()
        throws java.io.IOException,
               CSVException
        Performs the Write Operation using FileWriter Stream.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException
        CSVException - throws CSVException with exception message.
